DataElement.preferredName: BRAF Gene Analysis Result Outcome Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify the result of the Mutational analysis and sequencing of the BRAF gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis._Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in cell organization/biogenesis and the inhibition of apoptosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Analysis; examination and interpretation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).
